summary: Michael Goldsmith was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). He appears in payroll and certification reports from April 1978 to December 1978. These documents list his name, salary, and employment dates within the SCA. The documents do not specify his role within the committee, but his presence on payroll suggests he was a staff member involved in the investigation.
significance: Michael Goldsmith's significance lies in his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating his involvement in the investigation of the JFK assassination, although his specific role is not detailed in these documents.
